title: Jens Stoltenberg Biography | Santander International Banking Conference

quotes: NATO Allies have extended Mr. Stoltenberg’s term by unanimous consent four times, and his term will end on 1 October 2024.
Under Mr. Stoltenberg’s leadership, NATO has responded to a more challenging security environment by implementing the biggest reinforcement of its collective defense since the Cold War
Mr. Stoltenberg has played a critical role in rallying international support for Ukraine as it resists Russian aggression, particularly since Moscow’s full-fledged invasion in 2022.
Mr. Stoltenberg was Prime Minister during the deadly terrorist attacks that killed 77 people in Oslo and Utøya on 22 July 2011.

Mr. Stoltenberg holds a postgraduate degree in Economics from the University of Oslo. After graduating in 1987, he held a research post at the National Statistical Institute of Norway, before embarking on a career in Norwegian politics.
Jens Stoltenberg was born in Oslo on 16 March 1959.

organizations.name: European Union
quotes: Mr. Stoltenberg has long advocated for increased defense spending, and better burden sharing within the Alliance, and a greater focus on innovation and partnerships, including with the European Union.

organizations.name: High-Level UN commission on climate financing
quotes: Over many years, Jens Stoltenberg has been devoted to mitigating climate change. He chaired a High-Level UN commission on climate financing and served as a UN Special Envoy on Climate Change, helping to prepare the Paris Accord.

roles.title: UN Special Envoy on Climate Change
quotes: Over many years, Jens Stoltenberg has been devoted to mitigating climate change. He chaired a High-Level UN commission on climate financing and served as a UN Special Envoy on Climate Change, helping to prepare the Paris Accord.
Mr. Stoltenberg was Prime Minister during the deadly terrorist attacks that killed 77 people in Oslo and Utøya on 22 July 2011.
Jens Stoltenberg was born in Oslo on 16 March 1959.
Mr. Stoltenberg holds a postgraduate degree in Economics from the University of Oslo.
Mr. Stoltenberg was Prime Minister during the deadly terrorist attacks that killed 77 people in Oslo and Utøya on 22 July 2011.
As Prime Minister of Norway, Mr. Stoltenberg transformed the Norwegian armed forces with more defense spending and new high-end capabilities.
After graduating in 1987, he held a research post at the National Statistical Institute of Norway, before embarking on a career in Norwegian politics.

Under Mr. Stoltenberg’s leadership, NATO has responded to a more challenging security environment by implementing the biggest reinforcement of its collective defense since the Cold War – with more forces, increased defiance spending, and an unprecedented four rounds of NATO enlargement, with the accession of Montenegro, North Macedonia, Finland, and Sweden.

Under Mr. Stoltenberg’s leadership, NATO has responded to a more challenging security environment by implementing the biggest reinforcement of its collective defense since the Cold War – with more forces, increased defiance spending, and an unprecedented four rounds of NATO enlargement, with the accession of Montenegro, North Macedonia, Finland, and Sweden.
